page.title: 19MEDIA NEWSPAPERS LUTON
page.content: The pupils in our class answered some questions about newspapers. There were three daily newspapers the Sun, the Mirror and the Star in that order. 25% didn't have a daily newspaper. On Sundays the News of th World was the most popular with some taking the Sunday Mirror and Sunday People. 20% didn't have a Sunday paper. Almost all families recieved copies of the free weekly local papers, the Leader and the Herald. Only a third bought the Luton News. Newspapers were used, in the main, for looking up TV programmes. Just over half the class, 11/12year olds, read some of the stories and a handful liked the cartoons and sport.
